Description: Lehman Brothers collapse triggered global recession
Series of anti-government protests across Middle East
OPEC decided not to cut production, leading to price crash
WHO declared pandemic, global lockdowns reduced oil demand
Russian invasion led to sanctions and supply concerns
Civil war disrupted Libyan oil exports
Prices fell from $100 to $50 due to oversupply
Attack on Saudi oil facilities disrupted 5% of global supply
WTI crude futures fell to -$37 due to storage shortage
US reinstated sanctions on Iranian oil exports
US invasion of Iraq disrupted Middle East oil production
Iraq's invasion of Kuwait led to oil price spike
Deal lifted sanctions, allowing Iranian oil back to market
